Bill Venners wrote on 25.6.2011 0:36:
> ignored: test used to work, but I broke it and don't have time to fix it
> now. Don't want to delete it, so marking it ignored and have a good
> intention of coming back and fixing it later
>
> pending: fleshing out the "specification" of code I likely haven't written
> yet, but for sure the test I haven't written yet (pendingUntilFixed is a
> subset of this, for a bug I haven't fixed yet.)
>
> skipped: test skipped due to some assumption needed by the test not being
> met, such as a database being available on the network.
>
> The skipped concept shows up in JUnit as assumptions, and in TestNG as
> dependent tests, I think.

Thanks for a good list of different use cases.

I'm tempted to think of an abstraction to cover all those. Maybe it 
would be good to choose a new word... *opens up thesaurus* [1] How about 
"overlook" or "suppress"? :)

One option would be to allow testing frameworks to use any terms they 
wish, and the test runner would just report a free-form string provided 
by the testing freamework.

[1] http://thesaurus.com/browse/ignore

-- 
Esko Luontola
